intro: Hesperis degeniana, commonly known as the Dalmatian whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, and it typically grows in dry, rocky soils. Hesperis degeniana is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
